extendedIngredients.name: almond meal
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons almond meal (for nut free, replace with more of 1 of the above flours)
metaInformation: with more of 1 of the above flours)

extendedIngredients.name: baking powder
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 teaspoon baking powder

extendedIngredients.name: baking soda
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ teaspoon baking soda

extendedIngredients.name: brown rice flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup brown rice flour (or more oat/sorghum/millet)

extendedIngredients.name: brown sugar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/3 generous cup palm sugar or brown sugar (or more if you like them sweeter)

extendedIngredients.name: cinnamon
extendedIngredients.originalString: Optional Add In's: cinnamon, dark chocolate chips, diced berries

extendedIngredients.name: coconut oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ cup Spectrum Organic Shortening or Earth Balance Margarine, or coconut oil

extendedIngredients.name: coconut sugar
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup corn free powdered sugar, or powdered coconut sugar

extendedIngredients.name: dairy milk
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ cup non-dairy milk

extendedIngredients.name: Ener-G egg replacer
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 egg or Ener-G Egg Replacer for one egg mixed with a scant ¼ cup warm water
metaInformation: with a scant ¼ cup warm water

extendedIngredients.name: flax meal
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons chia or flax meal (optional)

extendedIngredients.name: guar gum
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ teaspoon guar gum

extendedIngredients.name: maple
extendedIngredients.originalString: Maple Glaze (enough for 12 mini donuts)

extendedIngredients.name: maple syrup
extendedIngredients.originalString: Maple syrup to achieve desired consistency (about 3-5 tablespoons)

extendedIngredients.name: margarine
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tablespoon melted Earth Balance Margarine or ghee

extendedIngredients.name: oat flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup gluten free oat flour (could use sorghum or millet too)

extendedIngredients.name: sea salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ teaspoon fine sea salt

extendedIngredients.name: tapioca starch
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup tapioca starch

extendedIngredients.name: vanilla extract
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

extendedIngredients.name: yogurt
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup vegan yogurt or sour cream (I used So Delicious plain yogurt)

recipes.title: Gluten Free Vegan Healthy Cake Donuts
recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees, lightly grease the donut pan.Whisk the dry ingredients together.Cut in the shortening with a pastry blender.Mix the egg, and yogurt together, stir in.Add the milk, 1 tablespoon at a time until the dough is firm but still a little sticky. You need to be able to pick it up and roll it between your hands. You could sprinkle additional flour to achieve this if necessary.Using your hands, roll a golf ball size piece of dough into a short snake. Snake it into the donut mold, overlapping the ends. You could use a damp finger to smooth the tops if you wanted to be perfect.Bake for 12-15 minutes until just done.Let cool a couple of minutes and invert on a cooling rack to avoid a soggy bottom.Top with powdered sugar, cinnamon/sugar mix, or the above maple glaze. I found these to be a wee bit crumbly right out of the pan, but not so after they cooled completely!

steps.step: Preheat oven to 350 degrees, lightly grease the donut pan.
Cut in the shortening with a pastry blender.
Mix the egg, and yogurt together, stir in.

Add the milk, 1 tablespoon at a time until the dough is firm but still a little sticky. You need to be able to pick it up and roll it between your hands. You could sprinkle additional flour to achieve this if necessary.Using your hands, roll a golf ball size piece of dough into a short snake. Snake it into the donut mold, overlapping the ends. You could use a damp finger to smooth the tops if you wanted to be perfect.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until just done.

Let cool a couple of minutes and invert on a cooling rack to avoid a soggy bottom.Top with powdered sugar, cinnamon/sugar mix, or the above maple glaze. I found these to be a wee bit crumbly right out of the pan, but not so after they cooled completely!
